displaytitle: Details of Costumes from Brasses in Waltham Abbey
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed: in graphite, upper center: from brasses in Waltham Abbey
signed: Inscribed, dated, and signed in graphite, lower right: 1555  1561 | and a splendid tomb figure | of Sir William Dency in armor | & his wife . about 1528- | and children in Alabaster painted | March 14/55 GHayter

titles.title: Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.
Details of Costumes from Brasses in Waltham Abbey

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England
